title.narrative: IR 5.5 EBOLA - APPUI AUX COMMUNAUTES AFFECTEES

description.narrative: EBOLA - APPUI AUX COMMUNAUTES AFFECTEES, which contributes to Child Health, Disaster Risk Reduction, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Immunization, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESSPCR 5: By the end of 2018, the most vulnerable children and their families, crises' victimes, have received timely and effective assistance those in post- crisis situations have benefited from improved and equitable access to social services and peaceful conflict mediation.

sector.narrative: Child health policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Disaster risk reduction (including linkage to climate change)
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: EBOLA - APPUI AUX COMMUNAUTES AFFECTEES

description.narrative: Pillar 3 delivers a complimentary Ebola response that addresses the significant social and humanitarian problems of the communities affected by the crisis. Its interventions contribute to strengthening resilience of communities while reducing their vulnerabilities, setting the basis for development work post-Ebola. Launched in June 2019, the Pillar 3 made good strides in working with local partners in volatile areas with limited access and acceptability to restore some basic social services and gained community trust which facilitated the programme delivery. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
